item.title: Zybooks
item.description: I was going to write a long rant about how much i despise north american math textbooks but I’ll leave that for later. I’ll just say that if I had studied math using these books I’d probably never have decided to pursue it as a career. I’m very glad that one of the casualties of this pandemic is going to be the calculus textbook (and its siblings). While planning for this course I came across several online textbooks that I plan to explore in detail sometime.

item.title: Let's do this
item.description: Teaching is a complex process. Where i’m using the word complex in the same way that atul gawande uses in the checklist manifesto. There are so a lot of moving parts from planning to execution and a lot of room for error. Sometimes small changes have large effects and sometimes a huge effort goes to complete waste. The way university math education currently works is that it is taken as self-evident that someone who is good at math is going to excel at teaching.
